00010 #include "Jamoma.h"

00012 
00013 // Prototypes
00014 void *receivemaster_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00015 void receivemaster_free(t_jcom_receivemaster *x);
00016 void receivemaster_dispatch(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00017 void receivemaster_add(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj);
00018 void receivemaster_remove(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj);
00019 
00020 
00021 // Globals
00022 static t_class          *s_receivemaster_class;         
00023 static t_hashtab        *s_receive_lists;                       
00024 
00025 
00026 /************************************************************************************/
00027 
00028 void receivemaster_initclass()
00029 {
00030         jamoma_init();
00031 
00032         // Define our class
00033         s_receivemaster_class = class_new(      "jcom.receivemaster", 
00034                                                                                 (method)receivemaster_new, 
00035                                                                                 (method)receivemaster_free, 
00036                                                                                 (short)sizeof(t_jcom_receivemaster), 
00037                                                                                 (method)0L, 
00038                                                                                 A_GIMME, 
00039                                                                                 0);
00040         class_obexoffset_set(s_receivemaster_class, calcoffset(t_jcom_receivemaster, obex));
00041 
00042         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00043         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_dispatch,  "dispatch",     A_CANT, 0L);
00044         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_add,               "add",          A_CANT, 0L);
00045         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_remove,    "remove",       A_CANT, 0L);
00046 
00047         // Finalize our class
00048         class_register(CLASS_NOBOX, s_receivemaster_class);
00049 }
00050 
00051 /************************************************************************************/
00052 // Object Life
00053 
00054 void *receivemaster_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00055 {
00056         t_jcom_receivemaster *x = (t_jcom_receivemaster *)object_alloc(s_receivemaster_class);
00057 
00058         if(!s_receive_lists)
00059                 s_receive_lists = hashtab_new(0);
00060         return x;
00061 }
00062 
00063 void receivemaster_free(t_jcom_receivemaster *x)
00064 {
00065         ;       // we could delete the hashtab, but this class is never deleted so it doesn't really make a difference
00066                 // does it?
00067 }
00068 
00069 
00070 /************************************************************************************/
00071 // Methods
00072 
00073 void receivemaster_dispatch(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00074 {
00075         t_linklist      *list = NULL;                                                                           // linklist of receives with this name
00076 
00077         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00078         if(list)
00079                 linklist_methodall(list, ps_dispatch, msg, argc, argv);         // 2. Call method on every object in the linklist
00080 }
00081 
00082 void receivemaster_add(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj)
00083 {
00084         t_linklist      *list = NULL;
00085 
00086         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00087         if(!list){
00088                 list = (t_linklist *)linklist_new();                                            // if there isn't a linklist for this name yet,
00089                 hashtab_store(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object *)list);         //      then we make one and store it in the hashtab
00090         }
00091         linklist_append(list, obj);                                                                             // 2. We add the object to the appropriate linklist
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 // TODO: When we switch to Max5 then remove these function definitions
00096 #if 1
00097 long linklist_match(void *a, void *b)
00098 {
00099         return a == b;
00100 }
00101 
00102 void linklist_chuckobject(t_linklist *x, void *o)
00103 {
00104         void *obj;
00105         
00106         long index = linklist_findfirst(x, &obj, linklist_match, o);
00107         if(index != -1)
00108                 linklist_chuckindex(x, index);
00109 }
00110 #endif
00111 
00112 
00113 void receivemaster_remove(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj)
00114 {
00115         t_linklist      *list = NULL;
00116 
00117         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00118         linklist_chuckobject(list, obj);
00119         if(!linklist_getsize(list))
00120                 hashtab_chuckkey(s_receive_lists, name);                                        // 2. Chuck the key if there are no more objects with this name
00121 }
